User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110510 Firefox/6.0a1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110510 Firefox/6.0a1

As the title says, a maximized window with tabs in the titlebar isn't easily dragable when there are many open tabs. The aimed workflow in Win7 Aero is to smash your mouse pointer against the top of the screen and drag the whole program.

Currently there is some very small place where you can do it, but it really slows down workflow do to the aiming work, which only needs to be done in FF. the whole top of the titlebar in win 7 should be reserved for the Aero drag. It's one of the few good things MS has invented. Before that, one needed 3 moves where we need 1 move now when for instance moving a maximised window from one screen to another.



Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open many tabs
2. while doing a lot of things, quickly (within half a second) drag a maximised window from one screen to another
3. notice that firefox is handicapped, you only have a bit space at the left and right, not even in the corners of the screen but right before. It takes too much time and effort

Actual Results:  
Annoyance because the one needs to aim, where any other application allows to bang the mouse anywhere on top for dragging.

Expected Results:  
within less than 1/2 seconds, my maximised window should be  either maximised on a 2nd screen, or be unmaximised and placed where you want.

This was addressed for FF4 in Bug 624129, but it was tagged resolved and fixed without general agreement at all. Any action at that bug is currently ignored, because it is wrongly tagged as resolved and fixed. (Quite a bureaucratic situation, no one using the Aero feature is content with the fix, but because it has been tagged, no one will ever work on it again, and any comments are killed by: "it's resolved and fixed".
This report start from the current "so-called-fixed" situation which still remains in nightly 6, and asks for a real fix of this problem.

comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110621 Firefox/7.0a1

Right about now this is how other browsers deal with this:

Opera - has small line at top of the screen that lets users drag from maximized window

Chrome - can be dragged from maximized mode only from tiny spaces between tabs (applicable to Firefox as well)

IE9 - Title bar that easily allows to drag from maximized mode

IMO, issue was extensively discussed in bug 624129 and the best compromise was reached.
